section.title: Water Procurement
section.paragraph: Water is more important than food for survival.
Find water sources: streams, rivers, morning dew.
Always purify water before drinking.
Boiling is the most reliable method.

section.title: Shelter Building
section.paragraph: Protection from elements is crucial.
Use natural materials: branches, leaves, rocks.
Build shelter before dark.
Insulate from ground to prevent heat loss.

section.title: Fire Making
section.paragraph: Fire provides warmth, light, and cooking ability.
Collect dry tinder, kindling, and fuel wood.
Use friction methods or fire starter if available.
Maintain fire once started.

section.title: Food Sources
section.paragraph: Plants: Learn to identify edible species.
Insects: High protein content.
Small game: Traps and snares.
Never eat unknown plants or mushrooms.

section.title: Signaling for Help
section.paragraph: Create visible signals: smoke, mirrors, bright colors.
Use sound: whistle, shouting in patterns.
Ground signals: SOS, arrows pointing to location.
Stay in one place if rescue is likely.

quotes.quote: Remember: Stay calm, think clearly, prioritize needs.
